Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: The student may attempt a basic drawing of a plant but with unclear details about water and light needs.
The drawing might include random labels or symbols not clearly indicative of water or light (e.g., a blue dot near the plant without context).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly illustrate healthy plant growth with plenty of water and light. (student doesn't grasp the cause and effect)
The student is unlikely to represent wilted or unhealthy characteristics accurately in a plant without water. (student doesn’t observe plant changes)
The student is unlikely to show that a plant without light is not growing well or is discolored. (student may assume lack of light isn’t significant)
The student is unlikely to consistently use drawings to describe how plants need water and light to live and grow. (attempts may be incomplete or incorrect)
